nationalyears5 = 2013 | nationalteam5 = [[Spain national under-20 football team|Spain U20]] | nationalcaps5 = 7 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam6 = [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] | nationalcaps6 = 7 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | club-update = 09:04, 3 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Javier Manquillo Gaitán''' ({{IPA-es|xaˈβjeɾ maŋˈkiʎo}}; born 5 May 1994) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] for English club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].
==Club career== ===Atlético Madrid=== Born in [[Madrid]], Manquillo started playing football with hometown's [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] alongside his twin brother Víctor, a [[Forward (association football)|forward]]. However, in mid-2007, the club decided to release the latter and the former followed suit, with both signing for neighbouring [[Atlético Madrid]] 48 hours later.<ref>[http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20111208/atletico-madrid/javi-manquillo-el-lateral-que-le-dijo-no-al-real-madrid-por-su-hermano_54240820214.html Javi Manquillo, el lateral que le dijo 'no' al Real Madrid por su hermano (Javi Manquillo, the full back who said 'no' to Real Madrid because of his brother)]; [[Mundo Deportivo]], 8 December 2011 (in Spanish)</ref> In November 2011 he made his unofficial debut with first team, playing in a [[Exhibition game|friendly game]] against [[Zamalek SC]];<ref>[http://www.atleticofans.com/10500/salvio-and-diego-secure-win-over-zamalek/ Salvio and Diego secure win over Zamalek]; Atlético Fans, 10 November 2011</ref> late into the month, he extended his contract until 2016.<ref>[http://www.atleticofans.com/10765/atletico-talent-signs-contract-through-2016/ Atlético talent signs contract through 2016]; Atlético Fans, 30 November 2011</ref>
On 8 December 2011, Manquillo made his official debut for the ''Colchoneros'', starting in a 1–2 away loss against [[Albacete Balompié]] in the [[Copa del Rey]] ([[2011–12 Copa del Rey|1–3 on aggregate]]).<ref>[http://www.marca.com/marcador/futbol/2011_12/copa/dieciseisavos/ida/alb_atm/ Adrián evita el naufragio (Adrián prevents shipwreck)]; [[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]], 8 December 2011 (in Spanish)</ref> He was subsequently an unused [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in the matches against [[Real Sociedad]] and [[Málaga CF]], whilst finishing [[2011–12 Segunda División B|the season]] in [[Segunda División B]] with 13 appearances for [[Atlético Madrid B|the B-side]].
On 28 November 2012, again in [[2012–13 Copa del Rey|the domestic cup]], Manquillo appeared in his second game with Atlético's main squad, playing 63 minutes in a 3–0 success at [[Real Jaén]].<ref>[http://www.atleticofans.com/15413/copa-del-rey-atletico-1-0-real-jaen/ Copa del Rey: Atlético 1–0 Real Jaén]; Atlético Fans, 28 November 2012</ref> On 6 December he featured in the 0–1 away defeat against [[FC Viktoria Plzeň]] in the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League]].<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2013/matches/round=2000356/match=2010014/postmatch/report/index.html#plzen+atletico Plzeň pip Atlético to take top spot]; UEFA, 6 December 2012</ref>
Manquillo's debut in [[La Liga]] came on 9 December 2012, coming on for [[Filipe Luís]] late into the second half of a 6–0 home routing of [[Deportivo de La Coruña]].<ref>[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=348372&cc=3888 Five-star show from Falcao]; [[ESPN FC]], 9 December 2012</ref> On 3 September of the following year he signed a contract extension with Atlético Madrid, keeping him at the [[Vicente Calderón Stadium]] until 2018.<ref>[http://www.marca.com/2013/09/03/futbol/equipos/atletico/1378213657.html Manquillo, Óliver Torres y Koke, hasta junio de 2018 (Manquillo, Óliver Torres and Koke, until June 2018)]; Marca, 3 September 2013 (in Spanish)</ref>
On 11 February 2014, in the first half of the [[2013–14 Copa del Rey|Spanish Cup semifinal clash]] against Real Madrid, Manquillo was involved in two incidents with [[Cristiano Ronaldo]]: in the early minutes, he conceded a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] which the Portuguese converted in the first goal of an eventual 2–0 win (5–0 on aggregate). Later, after both went for an aerial challenge, he fell headfirst to the ground,<ref>[http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/387326/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739 Ronaldo spot on for Real]; ESPN FC, 11 February 2014</ref><ref>[http://www.marca.com/2014/02/13/futbol/equipos/atletico/1392285700.html Manquillo estuvo al borde de la tragedia (Manquillo neared tragedy)]; Marca, 13 February 2014 (in Spanish)</ref> going on to be sidelined for more than one month with a [[neck]] injury.<ref>[http://www.marca.com/2014/02/12/futbol/equipos/atletico/1392215993.html Manquillo, un mes con collarín (Manquillo, one month with neck brace)]; Marca, 12 February 2014 (in Spanish)</ref>
On 6 August 2014, Manquillo joined [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in a two-year loan deal with an option to buy after [[2014–15 Premier League|his first season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/168205-reds-complete-manquillo-loan-move|title=Reds complete Manquillo loan move|publisher=Liverpool F.C|date=6 August 2014|accessdate=6 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clubatleticodemadrid.com/noticias/acuerdo-con-el-liverpool-para-la-cesion-de-manquillo|title=Acuerdo con el Liverpool para la cesión de Manquillo|trans-title=Agreement with Liverpool for Manquillo's loan|publisher=Atlético Madrid|date=6 August 2014|accessdate=6 August 2014}}</ref> He made his debut 11 days later, playing the full 90 minutes in a 2–1 [[Premier League]] win over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28730043|title=Liverpool 2–1 Southampton|first=David|last=Ornstein|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=17 August 2014|accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref> On 16 September, he won a 93rd-minute penalty in the [[UEFA Champions League]] tie against [[PFC Ludogorets Razgrad]], which [[Steven Gerrard]] converted to make the score 2–1 and win the match;<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29209558|title=Liverpool 2–1 Ludogorets Razgrad|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Sam|last=Sheringham|date=16 September 2014|accessdate=16 September 2014}}</ref> the following weekend, in [[2014–15 Football League Cup|the third round]] of the [[Football League Cup]], he converted his [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] attempt against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] as his team prevailed 14–13 following a 2–2 draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29216833|title=Liverpool 2–2 Middlesbrough|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Sam|last=Sheringham|date=23 September 2014|accessdate=23 September 2014}}</ref>
On 6 January 2015, Manquillo provided the [[Assist (football)|assist]] for the first of Gerrard's two goals in a [[2014–15 FA Cup|2–1 win]] at [[A.F.C. Wimbledon]] in the [[FA Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30620966|title=AFC Wimbledon 1–2 Liverpool|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Phil|last=McNulty|date=6 January 2015|accessdate=6 January 2015}}</ref> After featuring in 16 matches during the first part of [[2014–15 Premier League|the season]], he played just three times in 2015, never in the domestic league,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/liverpool/story/2511702/liverpool-considering-ending-javier-manquillo-loan|title=Liverpool considering ending Javier Manquillo loan|publisher=ESPN FC|first=Mike|last=Whalley|date=3 July 2015|accessdate=10 July 2015}}</ref> and Atlético Madrid subsequently confirmed that the loan deal had been terminated.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.clubatleticodemadrid.com/noticias/manquillo-will-not-stay-with-liverpool|title=Manquillo will not stay with Liverpool|publisher=Atlético Madrid|date=7 July 2015|accessdate=7 July 2015}}</ref>
On 27 July 2015, Manquillo joined [[Olympique de Marseille]] on a [[2015–16 Ligue 1|season]]-long loan with an option to buy.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.om.net/actualites/184513/javier-manquillo-est-olympien|title=Javier Manquillo est Olympien|trans-title=Javier Manquillo is an Olympian|language=French|publisher=Olympique Marseille|date=27 July 2015|accessdate=27 July 2015}}</ref> On 25 August of the following year, still owned by Atlético, he signed with English club [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] also for [[2016–17 Premier League|one season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2016/august/sunderland-seal-manquillo-deal|title=Sunderland seal Manquillo deal|publisher=Sunderland A.F.C|date=25 August 2016|access-date=25 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.atleticodemadrid.com/noticias/agreement-with-sunderland-for-the-loan-of-manquillo|title=Agreement with Sunderland for the loan of Manquillo|publisher=Atlético Madrid|date=25 August 2016|access-date=25 August 2016}}</ref>
===Newcastle United=== On 21 July 2017, Manquillo signed for Premier League club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on a three-year contract for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40683792|title=Javier Manquillo: Newcastle sign former Liverpool and Sunderland defender|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 July 2017|accessdate=21 July 2017}}</ref>
==International career== Manquillo earned 25 [[Cap (sport)|caps]] for [[Spain national youth football team|Spain at youth level]], including seven for [[Spain national under-21 football team|the under-21s]]. He made his debut on 4 September 2014, starting in a 1–0 win in [[Hungary national under-21 football team|Hungary]] for the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|qualifiers]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20140904/futbol/0-1-saul-niguez-sella-la-clasificacion-en-el-inicio-de-la-era-celades_54414672594.html|title=0–1: Saúl Ñíguez da la victoria en el estreno de Celades|trans-title=0–1: Saúl Ñíguez gives win in debut of Celades|publisher=Mundo Deportivo|language=es|date=4 September 2014|accessdate=4 December 2015}}</ref>
